info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 6:20PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Elbert and southwestern Abbeville Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 620 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elberton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elberton, Calhoun Falls, Lake Strom Thurmond, Russell State Park, Nancy Hart State Park, Middleton, Lake Russell, Bobby Brown State Park, Broad River Campground and Fortsonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northeastern Georgia...and Upstate South Carolina.
